jvn.title: WordPress 用 wp-google-maps プラグインにおける入力確認に関する脆弱性
jvn.summary: WordPress 用 wp-google-maps プラグインには、入力確認に関する脆弱性が存在します。

nvd.summary: In the wp-google-maps plugin before 7.11.18 for WordPress, includes/class.rest-api.php in the REST API does not sanitize field names before a SELECT statement.

wpscan.title: WP Google Maps 7.11.00-7.11.17 - Unauthenticated SQL Injection

metasploits.name: wp_google_maps_sqli.rb
metasploits.title: WordPress Google Maps Plugin SQL Injection
metasploits.description: This module exploits a SQL injection vulnerability in a REST endpoint registered by the WordPress plugin wp-google-maps between 7.11.00 and 7.11.17 (included). As the table prefix can be changed by administrators, set DB_PREFIX accordingly.

jvn.title: WordPress 用 WP Google Maps プラグインにおけるクロスサイトスクリプティングの脆弱性
jvn.summary: WordPress 用 WP Google Maps プラグインには、クロスサイトスクリプティングの脆弱性が存在します。

nvd.summary: The WP Google Maps plugin before 7.11.35 for WordPress allows XSS via the wp-admin/ rectangle_name or rectangle_opacity parameter.

wpscan.title: WP Google Maps <= 7.11.34 - CSRF to Stored XSS

jvn.title: WordPress 用 wp-google-maps プラグインにおけるクロスサイトスクリプティングの脆弱性
jvn.summary: WordPress 用 wp-google-maps プラグインには、クロスサイトスクリプティングの脆弱性が存在します。

nvd.summary: The wp-google-maps plugin before 7.10.43 for WordPress has XSS via the wp-admin/admin.php PATH_INFO.
WordPress before 5.5.2 mishandles deserialization requests in wp-includes/Requests/Utility/FilteredIterator.php.
WordPress before 5.5.2 mishandles embeds from disabled sites on a multisite network, as demonstrated by allowing a spam embed.

wpscan.title: WordPress < 5.5.2 - Disable Spam Embeds from Disabled Sites on a Multisite Network

nvd.summary: WordPress before 5.5.2 allows XSS associated with global variables.

wpscan.title: WordPress < 5.5.2 - Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via Global Variables

nvd.summary: WordPress before 5.5.2 allows attackers to gain privileges via XML-RPC.
wp-includes/class-wp-xmlrpc-server.php in WordPress before 5.5.2 allows attackers to gain privileges by using XML-RPC to comment on a post.

is_blog_installed in wp-includes/functions.php in WordPress before 5.5.2 improperly determines whether WordPress is already installed, which might allow an attacker to perform a new installation, leading to remote code execution (as well as a denial of service for the old installation).

wpscan.title: WordPress < 5.5.2 - Unauthenticated DoS Attack to RCE

nvd.summary: WordPress before 5.5.2 allows stored XSS via post slugs.

wpscan.title: WordPress < 5.5.2 - Stored XSS in Post Slugs

nvd.summary: is_protected_meta in wp-includes/meta.php in WordPress before 5.5.2 allows arbitrary file deletion because it does not properly determine whether a meta key is considered protected.

wpscan.title: WordPress < 5.5.2 - Protected Meta That Could Lead to Arbitrary File Deletion

nvd.summary: WordPress before 5.5.2 allows CSRF attacks that change a theme's background image.

wpscan.title: WordPress < 5.5.2 - Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) to Change Theme Background
WP Google Maps <= 7.11.27 - Admin Settings CSRF

en.name: Improper Input Validation
en.description: The product does not validate or incorrectly validates input that can affect the control flow or data flow of a program.
en.extendedDescription: When software does not validate input properly, an attacker is able to craft the input in a form that is not expected by the rest of the application. This will lead to parts of the system receiving unintended input, which may result in altered control flow, arbitrary control of a resource, or arbitrary code execution.

en.name: Improper Privilege Management
en.description: The software does not properly assign, modify, track, or check privileges for an actor, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.

en.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
en.description: The web application does not, or can not, sufficiently verify whether a well-formed, valid, consistent request was intentionally provided by the user who submitted the request.
en.extendedDescription: When a web server is designed to receive a request from a client without any mechanism for verifying that it was intentionally sent, then it might be possible for an attacker to trick a client into making an unintentional request to the web server which will be treated as an authentic request. This can be done via a URL, image load, XMLHttpRequest, etc. and can result in exposure of data or unintended code execution.

ja.name: クロスサイトリクエストフォージェリ(CWE-352)

en.name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
en.description: The application deserializes untrusted data without sufficiently verifying that the resulting data will be valid.

ja.name: 信頼性のないデータのデシリアライゼーション(CWE-502)

en.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
en.description: The software does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in output that is used as a web page that is served to other users.

ja.name: クロスサイトスクリプティング(CWE-79)
